ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were making large mouthfuls. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not make a mouthful that’s too large,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.4_0: One should not make mouthfuls that are too large.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes a large mouthful, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.13_0: if it is a special curry;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.14_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk39:1.17_0: The ninth rule, the training rule on nine, is finished.
